translated: The Paṭṭhāna Treatise🔽The reverse order of the law of conditionality, The Paṭṭhāna text with the Tikas

analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  uppanna ttika ādi kusala ttika
translated: The section on the present, etc., The section on the wholesome🔽An unarisen unwholesome state is a condition, as object condition, for an arisen wholesome state. As object, seven; as dominant, six; as support, six; as prenascence, postnascence, and dissociation, seven.

original: Nauppanno nakusalo dhammo uppannassa kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Ārammaṇe satta, adhipatiyā cha, upanissaye satta.🔽Nauppanno naakusalo dhammo uppannassa akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā cha, upanissaye cha.
analyzed: na uppannaḥ na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇe satta adhipatiyā cha upanissaye satta  na uppannaḥ na akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā cha upanissaye cha
translated: An unarisen unwholesome state is a condition, as object condition, for an arisen unwholesome state. As object, six; as dominant, six; as support, six.

original: Naanupanno naabyākato dhammo uppannassa abyākatassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: na anupannaḥ na abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa abyākatassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: An unarisen indeterminate state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an arisen indeterminate state. … three.

original: Nauppanno naabyākato dhammo uppannassa abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe satta, adhipatiyā cattāri, sahajāte nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye satta …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na uppannaḥ na abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppannassa abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta  hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe satta adhipatiyā cattāri sahajāte nissaye tīṇi upanissaye satta pe avigate tīṇi
translated: An unarisen indeterminate state is a condition, as object condition, for an arisen indeterminate state. (Abbreviated.)

As root-cause, three; as object, seven; as dominant, four; as conascence, … as support, three; as association, three; as presence, three; as non-disappearance, three; as kamma, three; as nutriment, three; as faculty, three; as jhāna, three; as path, three; as association, three; as presence, three; as non-disappearance, three; as kamma, three; as nutriment, three; as faculty, three; as jhāna, three; as path, three; as association, three; as presence, three; as non-disappearance, three; as kamma, three; as nutriment, three; as faculty, three; as jhāna, three; as path, three; as association, three; as presence, three; as non-disappearance, three; as kamma, three; as nutriment, three; as faculty, three; as jhāna, three; as path, three; as association, three; as presence, three; as non-disappearance, three; as kamma, three; as nutriment, three; as faculty, three; as jhāna, three; as path, three; as association, three; as presence, three; as non-disappearance, three; as kamma, three; as nutriment, three; as faculty, three; as jhāna, three; as path, three; as association, three; as presence, three; as non-disappearance, three;
